title: An own implemented ERC20 or a created ERC20 by `OptimismMintableERC20Factory`?
body:
<!--
Need help?
Refer to our contributing guidelines for additional information about making a good issue:
https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->
Just question.

We are preparing to deploy an ERC20 token on Optimism L2. Our token is already on ETH. We want to deploy a token that implements `IERC1363` for compatibility with the tokens on ETH, and we have confirmed that it can be paired to the origin on the StandardBridge as long as we implements `IOptimismMintableERC20` for the token. But we are debating whether to link our own implemented token or a token created through `createOptimismMintableERC20()`.
When createOptimismMintableERC20() is executed, it seems that the `OptimismMintableERC20Created` event is issued(https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/blob/38c8a267788f1ffd13139656638bdb31de78eda5/packages/contracts-bedrock/src/universal/OptimismMintableERC20Factory.sol#L83). Is this event particularly important? Can you tell me where it is used?
